nodes.text: During the Galactic Empire's reign over the galaxy, which began in 19 BBY, and prior to the Battle of Hoth in 3 ABY, a campaign occurred on Culroon III. The conflict involved the Empire and the Culroonians, the inhabitants of Culroon III, and occurred as a result of a revolt there. The human male Maximilian Veers participated in the campaign on behalf of the Empire, where he demonstrated his courage and cunning and secured victory for the Empire through new tactics he had developed. Veers' actions led to his eventual promotion to the rank of general in the Imperial Army, and he was recognized by the Sith Lord Darth Vader, who requested Veers' assignment to his own Death Squadron.

The conflict on Culroon III was given an indirect mention in canon in Adam Gidwitz's 2015 children's book So You Want to Be a Jedi?, a retelling of the 1980 film Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back. It was referred to as a campaign in Star Wars: The Galactic Explorer's Guide, a 2019 reference book by Jason Fry.

In the Star Wars Legends continuity a battle involving the Empire and the native Culroon of the planet Culroon III appeared in a short story called "The Promotion of Lieutenant Veers," published in The Star Wars Sourcebook in 1987. In the story, Maximilian Veers received a promotion from lieutenant to major after securing an Imperial victory.
